page.title: 05Entertainment
page.content: BODELWYDDAN CASTLE continued Clwyd County Council have given Bodelwyddan Castle's Great Hall a major face-lift in a bid to make it the area's best cultural centre. It is hoped that the Great Hall will provide a venue for all sorts of groups to meet and to perform. The Great Hall has kept much of its old school look because of its high ceiling. The accoustics there are very good because of the height. Adjoining the Hall, the old domestic science block has been converted into a coffee lounge and bar. Another feature which it is hoped will attract music lovers is the 75 year old concert piano which the council acquired with the contents of the college. It is a Steinway piano valued at more than Â£250,000 which has also been renovated.
